attributes.action: Cap Benefits for a maximum of 3 kids starting from the day of implementation.
attributes.background: Lets deter people from having kids for benefit reasons. By capping benefits at three kids we can reduce the benefit bill, stop people from taking advantage of the system.

attributes.action: If Trump is elected President the UK should cut all diplomatic ties with the US.
attributes.background: If trump implements any of the policies he has announced, denying non US Citizen Muslims entry to the country, allowing torture, the killing of terrorist's families etc etc.  The UK Government should recall its ambassador, cut all ties and designate the US a 'Rogue State"

attributes.action: KEEP current tax allowances on the 25% lump sum and contributions for pensions
attributes.background:
Currently pension contributions are paid from your income BEFORE it is taxed.  And when you take your pension, you can take 25% of it tax free. 
The chancellor is considering changing this IN THE16th MARCH BUDGET so that the 25% is taxed AND tax is taken BEFORE you contribute into your pension.
attributes.additional_details:
If this is implemented your contributions into a pension may be taxed BEFORE you contribute thus reducing how much you can save or increasing the tax on your income.
Similarly the entire pot may be taxed when you take it! 
Pension pots take years to accrue and changes can be devastating especially to people near retirement.
Even if you have taken your pension this would affect your family and friends.
We need to tell the chancellor to STOP MESSING WITH PEOPLES PENSIONS.

attributes.action: Stop Landlords refusing DSS
attributes.background:
I see a lot of people struggling to get a flat, or house, due to the Landlord refusing to accept DSS. It does not matter whether the Landlord knows the circumstances as to why DSS is required!

Stop the discrimination - Stop allowing Landlords the right to refuse DSS claimants as tenants!

attributes.action: Link University Tuition Fees to the Hours Required for a Degree and Minimum Wage
attributes.background: Currently, university costs most full time students Â£9000, which for students aged 21+ would take them 1343 hours to earn and 1698 hours for 18-20 year olds on minimum wage, the rate a lot of students earn at. Whilst contact hours are variable across institutions, subjects and years of study ...
attributes.additional_details: the hours that are required to earn the degree are reasonably consistent and the vast majority of the time advertised at the beginning of the course. 100 hours of work, be it in lectures, completing assignments etc. are often required for 10 credits, and 120 credits are typically undertaken each year. We ask the government to link tuition fees to the hours of work put in and the minimum wage so that students are charged no more than they would earn on minimum wage working for the same duration.

attributes.action: Create UK specific symbol that represents visible and non-visible disabilities.
attributes.background: The International Symbol of Accessibility (ISA) - Wheelchair Symbol - is often confused being representative of all disabilities. This can, itself, cause discrimination for people with non-visible disabilities e.g. mental-ill health. A UK symbol to sit alongside the ISA would be a powerful message.
attributes.additional_details: Much has been learnt about symbolism and imagery. The UK are world leaders in addressing this in terms of equality. It would therefore be advantageous to make the final step to acknowledging all disabilities.. Paving the way for a future-proofed global emblem, coupled with positive communications tackling negative attitudes experienced by many when benchmarked against physical/visible conditions. Complimenting the current accessible symbol would start us down that path.

attributes.action: Allow dogs to visit consenting long staying patients in hospitals.
attributes.background: Research in America has demonstrated the uplifting effects experienced by both patients and staff when dogs are allowed to wander around hospital corridors and wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs probably will not directly help a human to recover from illness, but dogs make humans happy. And feeling happy does make humans more likely to recover from illness.

The petitioner has been unable to find evidence of any diseases which are carried by dogs being transmitted to humans. 

How many diseases can you think of which a dog can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

How many diseases can you think of which a human can transmit to a human during a hospital visit?

attributes.action: That MPs should work full time as an MP and not have outside jobs.
attributes.background: A large number of MPs appear to have numerous second jobs. My view is that being an MP should be a full time job. If they can find time to do many other jobs then they should be paid pro rata. If they have time to do other jobs then perhaps they shouldn't be an MP.
attributes.additional_details: I am also fed up of watching parliament in progress with hardly any MPs in the chamber.They are answerable to the public as they are paid out of taxes and as such are public employees. Very few employees in the public sector are allowed to have second jobs, so why should they be allowed to be able to do this.

attributes.action: for the government to provide funding , equipment and the specialist staff

attributes.additional_details: people in kent should be treated in there local hospitals and not sent to st Thomas in London,the government should provide funding,equipment and the specialist staff to hospitals in kent

attributes.action: Enable better access to emergency funding for academies awaiting a pupils EHCP
attributes.background: Currently academies cannot access emergency funding to give special needs children support above the statutory 13 hours and the wait time for an EHCP is far too long without an emergency provision. With the government push to make schools gain academy status this is leaving SEN children underfunded
attributes.additional_details: Gaining an EHCP to access funding for an SEN child is a complicated and long process, leaving months in the interim with no funding for support. Early years settings can get emergency funding for these situations, as can non academy schools, but with the government push for schools to become academies, children are getting lost in the gaps, leaving schools underfunded and understaffed for children with SEN. Allowing emergency funding for academies is desperately needed

attributes.action: Change the cap on family income, making more people eligible for bursaries.
attributes.background: Many students struggle with the finances of study. And no person should have to worry about finances in the UK. The government should offer bursaries to more students by removing/changing the cap on what makes a person eligible for extra funding from the government.

attributes.action: Bring State Pension To 63 years of age ,Bring it Down From 65 Years Age To 63

attributes.background: When I am commuting daily during office hours and school run, I see much of the traffic slowed down due to heavy vehicles like trucks. If they were asked not to run during 7.30 am -9.30 am and then between 3 pm -5 pm , I think it would go a long way in reducing the traffic congestion.

attributes.background: Young voters are statistically proven to have a poorer turnout to elections than older voters, despite having to live longer with the results. attributes.action: Make the Scottish Government responsible for Scottish immigration policy
attributes.background:
Scotland must develop and enact its own policy on non-EU migration. This may also enable Scotland to determine its own migration relationship with the EU.

The Scotland Act 1998 must be amended with an act of Parliament. Scottish Government must then create a responsible ministerial department.
attributes.additional_details:
The immigration needs of Scotland are different to the demands of England. Enforcing the same immigration policy in both countries is illogical.

It will help Scotland's slow economic and population growth, and also some Tier 2 skilled workers who will otherwise be forced to leave the UK by the Â£35k settlement threshold. Tier 2 workers unwanted by England will have the option to live, and be valued, in a nearby nation, where they can visit their loved ones regularly.

attributes.action: Call a general election or allow a vote on repealing the Communities Act 1972.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to either call a general election or ensure that there is a vote in parliament for repealing the European Communities Act 1972 before invoking Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
We feel that you owe the electorate and/or Parliament a choice given that :-

Scotland, Northern Ireland, Gibraltar, London and 75% of MPs all voted to remain.

The UK Leave majority was slim, so there is not a strong mandate to leave.

There is currently no leadership in either of the main parties.

There is a constitutional crisis which threatens the breakup of two Unions.

That the defacto leader of the Leave campaign will not stand as PM.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: Establish support mechanisms to aid people experiencing abuse due to Brexit.
attributes.background: This petition asks Parliament to urgently recommend putting in place visible resources (web, social & phone) so that members of the public who have been subject to abuse related to Brexit know where to turn to seek advice and the support of concerned and loving members of their community.
attributes.additional_details: Reports of members of the public being subjected to racial or xenophobic abuse has increased noticeably since Brexit. Mechanisms exist to report such hate crimes to the police but there is little visible information connecting the victim or scared member o/t public to volunteer groups representing caring individuals in the community or for those who wish to help, to join together. This issue needs a national voice and to be seen as the responsibility of all ordinary decent civilians.

attributes.action: Until Brexit Article 50 details are agreed, plans for HS2 should be put on hold.
attributes.background: The UK is undergoing considerable economic and financial strain. As this situation will continue, at least, until such time as all the EU severance details (Article 50) are worked through, the UK Government should put an immediate stop and hold on any further development of the HS2 project.

attributes.action: Create a clear legal framework for UK-wide referenda
attributes.background:
The EU Referendum highlighted the problems of using this democratic tool in the U.K,: a small majority, rejection by two home nations, and purely advisory in nature.
This vagueness, uncertainty, and unfairness is plainly unsatisfactory and must be addressed before any future referenda are held.
attributes.additional_details:
It is proposed that a referendum shall be binding on the Government if either of the following criteria is met:
- The votes for the winning side total at least 50% of the total number of those eligible to vote plus one, or
- The winning side is supported by simple majorities in at least three of the four home nations, and by at least two-thirds of the total votes cast.
In all other cases, the Government shall be required to take note of the result of the referendum, but is not bound by it.

attributes.action: Ban gender-specific uniform policies
attributes.background:
Equality movements started being effective in the 1960's, yet we haven't seen modern equality spread to school uniform policy. 
Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born. 
This would also help fight abuse towards transgender schoolchildren.

attributes.action: Introduce a complaints commission that holds the UK press truly accountable
attributes.background: We petition to replace IPSO with a regulator that actually holds the UK press to account (similar to ofcom), and take measures such as not allowing a complete bias, active investigation of misleading headlines and apologies on the same scale as the original article. Regulation should be mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: The recent referendum campaign was an example of the how toxic the UK press have become and how well they are misinforming the UK public for ulterior motives. The fact that Rupert Murdoch can use the UK press to the to fulfill his own anti-EU agenda and at the same time maintain a friendship with our prime minister shows just how corrupt the whole system is.  To abide with IPSO is not even mandatory, and the more impartial press outlets refuse to be part of it out of protest of its uselessness.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Set out principles for any negotiation pertaining to leaving the European Union
attributes.background: Parliament should vote on a motion supporting access to European markets, free movement of people, and compatibility with major areas of European law. This being a move to boost confidence for business and markets, and to reassure the European citizens living and working in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently great uncertainty and anxiety both for business and financial markets, and for the many Europeans who live and work as part of our communities; friends, colleagues and loved ones. Parliament should act to create certainty and confidence, setting out the principles on which any negotiation should be based. This should include the key areas such as free movement, access to markets, and legal compatibility such topics as data protection.

attributes.action: Referendum results less than 60-40 and 75% turnout should go to a second round.
attributes.background: The two most recent referendums (referenda) in the UK did not 'convincingly' reflect the opinion of the general public and did not prove their wishes beyond 'reasonable doubt'.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Amend the Human Rights Act to support informed public debate.
attributes.background: Only when we have a clear view of issues can we make informed choice, people cannot make functional choices when they do not know what they are choosing. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.
attributes.additional_details: I propose an additional article under the UK Human Rights Act which prevents the dumbing down and obfuscation of public debate. It is the duty of public servants to bring clarity and accuracy to public debate to establish objectives and clean information both pro and con. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nigel Farage in the Parliament for UK Independance Day.
attributes.background: Nigel Farage dedicated his life to Britain's freedom. The exit from EU was only possible thanks to his decades long struggle against EU bureaucracy and him raising awareness. As a way to celebrate the man and his accomplishments we would like to erect a statue of himself in the Members' Lobby.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Have better support for people with learning disabilities in schools
attributes.background: Aa someone who has learning disabilities I feel like I havent had enough support.

attributes.action: New EU referendum should Scotland leave the UK and break the Union.
attributes.background: This petition calls for a suspension of any action for an exit from the EU until the issue of Scottish independance is resolved. If Scotland leave and the UK breaks up then a new question would need to be posed, reflecting the nature of the change, the original question becoming invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims for Parliament to consider and plan through any serious changes that may result from Scottish independance and the impact this would have on the recent referendum result and mindset of the voting public.

The original referendum question posed was for the United Kingdom exiting the EU, should Scotland gain independance then the UK breaks up and the question is void, given the change of circumstances.

attributes.action: Put more funding towards schools and other public services.
attributes.background: Public services such as schools and the NHS are not very well funded. After leaving the EU, we will be apparently saving Â£350 million a week. Some of this money should go to public services.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Change how the UK is governed to better serve and protect the British public.
attributes.background: Currently the key decision makers in the UK in the House of Lords are un-elected. They are appointed by being vetted by the Appointments Commission, then approved by the prime minister and formalised by the Queen. We feel that all aspects of our Government, especially key members should be elected.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that:

All members of the House of Lords are appointed by the public's vote only and each members term is subjected to a vote every 5 years.

If voted out, their position is to be replaced by a member elected by public vote.

Membership is to open to all current and former MP's.
 
If a MP is currently serving when elected to the House of Lords, their local position is to be replaced by a member of their own party. This member is to be elected by the people in their constituency only.

attributes.action: Allow the City and Greater London to join the EU
attributes.background: Given the EU referendum result showed a large discrepancy of opinion between those voting in London and those voting in England and Wales, we would like to initiate proceedings for the City and Greater London to join the EU.

attributes.action: A new referendum: Leave the EU now or in 2036 (subject to a further referendum)?
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU which is irreversible. We now need a referendum to ascertain whether we leave the EU now or in 20 years' time (subject to a further referendum, of course)?
attributes.additional_details: The EU is not perfect and will probably be subject to some kind of reform in the coming decades. This additional referendum is to find out if the UK population would like postpone our exit pending any changes that may occur within the union.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Form an emergency government made of leaders of each major political party
attributes.background:
This emergency government will be responsible for negotiating the exit from the EU.
Nominated leaders from each major political party will join together to negotiate so that every member of the public will be represented, and not just those who voted for a particular individual party.

attributes.action: Make Bristol an independent city state to rejoin the European Union.
attributes.background: The majority of Bristol voted to remain in the EU.  Lets make our vote count!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Greater London becoming an independent, EU member state
attributes.background: We want a referendum held in Greater London on becoming an independent, federal state, that will remain a member of the European Union. This reflects the wishes of the majority of Londoners to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details: The referendum on the 23rd of June clearly showed a divide in the beliefs of Londoners and the majority of the rest of England. Continued membership of the EU is vital if London is to remain the biggest financial centre in Europe. In addition, leaving would clearly go against the wishes of the majority of Londoners. We also believe that a divorce from the UK would be less traumatic than a split from the 450 million strong EU population

We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard!

All historic cases should use the current sentencing for historic cases also
attributes.additional_details: The current cases means that someone who abused someone in 1970's or 1980's only allows a person to be prosecuted under the laws of that time undermining the sentencing of someone who may have committed abhorent crimes against people, this would allow a better and more efficient way to proscute historical sexual crimes.

attributes.action: Protect identities of those subject to unsubstantiated allegations of sex abuse

Several big name celebrities have been accused of historic sex abuse  their identities released to the public domain before any of the unsubstantiated allegations have been investigated.
I want to see a change in the law that protects the identity of these persons until charged with any offences.

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Oppose changes to make you pay full market rent on your council home.

attributes.additional_details: Ending secure council tenancies means the government is legislating to deny families a stable home.
